Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Kayak \Kay"ak\, n. (Naut.) A light canoe, made of skins stretched over a frame, and usually capable of carrying but one person, who sits amidships and uses a double-bladed paddle. It is peculiar to the Eskimos and other Arctic tribes. [1913 Webster]
kayak n : a small canoe consisting of a light frame made watertight with animal skins; used by Eskimos v : travel in a small canoe; "we kayaked down the river"
